info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: firewallPolicyName
parameters.description: The name of the Firewall Policy.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Request successful. Resource with the specified name does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: firewallPolicyName
parameters.description: The name of the Firewall Policy.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expands referenced resources.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a Firewall Policy resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates the specified Firewall Policy.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: firewallPolicyName
parameters.description: The name of the Firewall Policy.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update Firewall Policy operation.

201.description: Request received successfully. The operation returns the resulting FirewallPolicy resource.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting FirewallPolicy resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all Firewall Policies in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of FirewallPolicy resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

identity.description: The identity of the firewall policy.

Probe.description: Probe describes a health check to be performed against an App Instance to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

disableProbe.description: Indicate whether the probe is disabled.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the App Instance has started before probes are initiated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Minimum value is 1.

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Minimum value is 1.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Minimum value is 1.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1.

startupProbe.description: StartupProbe indicates that the App Instance has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a App Instance's lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

readinessProbe.description: Periodic probe of App Instance service readiness. App Instance will be removed from service endpoints if the probe fails. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the firewall policy resource.

basePolicy.description: The parent firewall policy from which rules are inherited.

firewalls.description: List of references to Azure Firewalls that this Firewall Policy is associated with.

childPolicies.description: List of references to Child Firewall Policies.

snat.description: The private IP addresses/IP ranges to which traffic will not be SNAT.

certificateAuthority.description: The CA used for intermediate CA generation.

FirewallPolicyTransportSecurity.description: Configuration needed to perform TLS termination & initiation.

keyVaultSecretId.description: Secret Id of (base-64 encoded unencrypted pfx) 'Secret' or 'Certificate' object stored in KeyVault.

FirewallPolicyCertificateAuthority.description: Trusted Root certificates properties for tls.

FirewallPolicyIntrusionDetection.description: Configuration for intrusion detection mode and rules.

FirewallPolicyIntrusionDetectionConfigur.description: The operation for configuring intrusion detection.

bypassTrafficSettings.description: List of rules for traffic to bypass.

name.description: Name of the bypass traffic rule.

description.description: Description of the bypass traffic rule.

sourceAddresses.description: List of source IP addresses or ranges for this rule.

destinationAddresses.description: List of destination IP addresses or ranges for this rule.

destinationPorts.description: List of destination ports or ranges.

sourceIpGroups.description: List of source IpGroups for this rule.

destinationIpGroups.description: List of destination IpGroups for this rule.

FirewallPolicyIntrusionDetectionBypassTr.description: Possible intrusion detection bypass traffic protocols.

DnsSettings.description: DNS Proxy Settings in Firewall Policy.

enableProxy.description: Enable DNS Proxy on Firewalls attached to the Firewall Policy.

requireProxyForNetworkRules.description: FQDNs in Network Rules are supported when set to true.

FirewallPolicySNAT.description: The private IP addresses/IP ranges to which traffic will not be SNAT.

privateRanges.description: List of private IP addresses/IP address ranges to not be SNAT.

isEnabled.description: A flag to indicate if the insights are enabled on the policy.

retentionDays.description: Number of days the insights should be enabled on the policy.

logAnalyticsResources.description: Workspaces needed to configure the Firewall Policy Insights.

FirewallPolicyLogAnalyticsResources.description: Log Analytics Resources for Firewall Policy Insights.

workspaces.description: List of workspaces for Firewall Policy Insights.

defaultWorkspaceId.description: The default workspace Id for Firewall Policy Insights.

FirewallPolicyLogAnalyticsWorkspace.description: Log Analytics Workspace for Firewall Policy Insights.

workspaceId.description: The workspace Id for Firewall Policy Insights.

ipAddresses.description: List of IP addresses for the ThreatIntel Whitelist.

fqdns.description: List of FQDNs for the ThreatIntel Whitelist.

value.description: List of Firewall Policies in a resource group.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

FirewallPolicyListResult.description: Response for ListFirewallPolicies API service call.

priority.description: Priority of the Firewall Policy Rule Collection resource.

action.description: The action type of a Nat rule collection.

rules.description: List of rules included in a rule collection.

rules.description: List of rules included in a rule collection.
